snippet: Detroit is emerging from the largest municipal bankruptcy in American history. Yet it still faces a test of finding a sustainable course for a struggling city.
abstract: Detroit officially emerges from biggest municipal bankruptcy in nation's history, yet city still faces hard and long road ahead in recovery; reorganization plan allows Detroit to shed $7 billion of its debts and spend about $1.7 billion to restore and reshape city services over next decade.
lead_paragraph: Detroit is emerging from the largest municipal bankruptcy in American history. Yet it still faces a test of finding a sustainable course for a struggling city.

headline.main: Detroit Is Out of Bankruptcy, but Not Out of the Woods
headline.print_headline: Detroit Out of Bankruptcy but Not Out of the Woods
